ygData.subject: Tired.
ygData.msgSnippet: * Diana kept on running, her tiny paws burning in the heat of the sand, thinking that that spider had been right to try and find some shade. But there was none

* Diana kept on running, her tiny paws burning in the heat of the sand, 
thinking that that spider had been right to try and find some shade.
But there was none as far as she could see, her pod long lost among the 
dunes, as well as the spider.

She panted as she ran, her foot falls equally seeming to tire out from when 
she first started, now just a jog.
Wishing that she would have had scales or something, or at least a razor to 
get rid of all this fur!

There was a familier blip on her internal screens, something that reminded 
her of the fire and all the screaming, something that made her want to find 
out who belonged to that blip mpre then anything else in the world. She kept 
remembering a name, her best friends name, Rion.
If her guard had placed her in a pod, could his own have done the same to 
him? And was he here now, HIS blip she was seeing?
If it was so, if it really was him, she would find him.*

" Rion!!"

* She called out once she was 200 meters from where the blip was, her feet 
feeling burnt, clumbsy and weighted as she kept on running. Her little wings 
fanning and trying to cool her back.*

" RION!!!!"

* Diana screamed as loud as she could before she suddenly tripped on her own 
feet, her furred form simply falling to the ground.
She hadn't known it before but voltures, they had been following her, and 
now wheeled around in the sky above as Diana lay there, trying to get to her 
feet.
But she was so tired and her feet had already taken her a far way...any 
further was not required of them.
But when she didn't move anymore the voltures began to wheel down towards 
the fur lump on the sand, finally dropping to the ground and fluffing their 
wings.

Diana raised her head and hissed at them, her fur rising and her claws 
extending, but none of the monsters came close.
Too tired to rais to her feet, too scared to move. She just stayed ther and 
hissed, trying to make sure that their sharp beaks stayed well away from 
her.*
